title: NASA Sets Coverage for Agency’s SpaceX Crew-9 Launch, Docking
summary: NASA will provide coverage of the upcoming prelaunch and launch activities for the agency’s SpaceX Crew-9 mission to the International Space Station. Liftoff is targeted for 1:17 p.m. EDT, Saturday, Sept. 28, from Space Launch Complex-40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. This is the first human spaceflight mission to launch from that […]

title: Space Force awards $25 million contract for satellite data integration
summary: Outside Analytics will support sensor data analysis at the Space Force’s TAP Lab

title: NASA Wallops to Support Sounding Rocket Launch
summary: NASA’s Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia is scheduled to support the launch of a suborbital sounding rocket for the Department of Defense during a launch window that runs 1:45 to 6:30 p.m. EDT each day from Sept. 26 to 30.  No real-time launch status updates will be available and the launch will not be livestreamed.  […]

title: Space Force eyes commercial antennas to boost satellite control capacity
summary: The Space Systems Command is interested in creating a "commercial antenna marketplace”

title: NASA’s Art Program is Back
summary: NASA launched its reimagined art program by unveiling two murals on Sept. 23, 2024. The murals, titled “To the Moon, and Back,” were created by New York-based artist team Geraluz and WERC and use geometrical patterns to invite deeper reflection on the exploration, creativity, and connection with the cosmos. The vision of this next phase […]

title: SpaceX calls out FAA’s ‘deeply concerning’ statements in front of Congress
summary: SpaceX called out Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) administrator Mike Whitaker for making “several incorrect” and “deeply concerning” statements in front of Congress...

title: Meet Hector Chavez: Leading Johnson’s Giant Leap into Low Earth Orbit
summary: As systems integration team lead for NASA’s Commercial Low Earth Orbit Development Program (CLDP), Hector Chavez helps build a future where NASA and private industry work together to push the boundaries of space exploration. With the rise of commercial providers in the space sector, Chavez’s team works to ensure that these companies can develop end-to-end […]

title: NASA Michoud Continues Work on Evolved Stage of SLS Rocket for Future Artemis Missions
summary: Manufacturing equipment that will be used to build components for NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket for future Artemis missions is being installed at the agency’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans, Louisiana. The novel tooling will be used to produce the SLS rocket’s advanced exploration upper stage, or EUS, in the factory’s new manufacturing […]

title: All The Stars Align for a Record-Breaking Breaking 75th IAC
summary: During the week 14 – 18 October 2024 Milan transforms into the world’s space capital with the arrival of thousands of experts, scientists, industry professionals, and, of course, astronauts! The […]

title: Webb finds potential missing link to first stars
summary: Looking deep into the early Universe with the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope, astronomers have found something unprecedented: a galaxy with an odd light signature, which they attribute to its gas outshining its stars.
